body_html:
Dilated convolution is definitely supported in CuDNN 6.0 now (just released), see #8828

In cudnnSetConvolutionNdDescriptor, previously unused “upscale” fields
have been repurposed to allow user specification of dilation factors along each
dimension. This does not alter existing behavior (which required the upscale
fields to be set to 1). However, these fields can now be set to a value greater than
1, to perform dilated convolutions while using the algorithms specified in the
“New Features” section of these Release Notes.

1, to perform dilated convolutions while using the algorithms specified in the
“New Features” section of these Release Notes.
body:
Dilated convolution is definitely supported in CuDNN 6.0 now (just released), see https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/8828

```
In cudnnSetConvolutionNdDescriptor, previously unused “upscale” fields
have been repurposed to allow user specification of dilation factors along each
dimension. This does not alter existing behavior (which required the upscale
fields to be set to 1). However, these fields can now be set to a value greater than
1, to perform dilated convolutions while using the algorithms specified in the
“New Features” section of these Release Notes.
```
